isis.stitle: HEAT VENTILATION AIR CONDITIONING (HVAC) SYSTEM - ProStar - REMOVE AND INSTALL - A/C REFRIGERANT HOSES (FRONT SYSTEM LONG LINES)

svcproc.title: A/C REFRIGERANT HOSES (FRONT SYSTEM LONG LINES)

svcprocinfo.para: The three A/C refrigerant hoses/lines (1, 2, and 4, Figure 29) are connected in the same way; however, the number of mounting straps and clamps may be different for each hose. Also, the routing of each hose varies for each vehicle model/engine combination.

Depending on the vehicle model/engine combination, replacement of specific A/C refrigerant lines may require the removal of nearby assemblies to gain access to the fittings, or to remove the A/C lines. Refer to the appropriate section(s) in the Master Service Manual for additional procedures.

note.para: Refer to Figure 29 while performing the following Remove and Install procedures.

step1.para: Discharge A/C system. Refer to DISCHARGING THE SYSTEM .

note.para: When removing Condenser-to-Evaporator Hose (4, Figure 29) disconnect electrical connection to pressure transducer (5).

step1.para: Disconnect fitting at each end of hose/line being removed.
Unclip or remove all hose support clamps and strap locks used to secure hose/line. Note location and orientation of each clamp and strap lock to allow for correct routing during installation.

note.para: When replacing Condenser-to-Evaporator line (4) remove pressure transducer (5) from old line for transfer to new line.
Before installing a new Condenser-to-Evaporator line (4, Figure 29) it may be necessary to transfer pressure transducer (5) from the old line to the new line.

step1.para:
If A/C system is to be flushed or purged, perform that operation before reassembling the system. Refer to PURGING OR FLUSHING THE AIR CONDITIONING SYSTEM
.
Place new A/C hose/line in its approximate location.

note.para: Always lubricate O-rings with mineral-based oil during installation.

step1.para: Using new O-rings and C-plates connect fittings at each end of the A/C hose/line. Tighten to 19,000 to 21,000 N.mm (170 to 190 lbf-in).
Secure the hose/line using all support clamps and strap locks removed during removal.

Recharge A/C system. Refer to CHARGING THE AIR CONDITIONING SYSTEM
.

note.para: After installing Evaporator-to-Compressor line (1) the cab cowl tray must be installed. Refer to the appropriate CAB Section in Group 16 of the Master Service Manual for procedures covering all cab cowl trays.
